title: Were Dravidas mentioned as Mlecchas? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Mlecchas were a tribe coming from Malakka.The Malakka was mostly aborigines. Many of them are still in today's Indonesia. Dravidians were mostly addressed as Dhakins, which literally is derived from Dakshin, meaning south. They addressed some which they considered as evil spirits, as DHAKINI or SHAKINI

response.answer_text: No. Mlecchas are those who are foreign to the Aryan ie Vedic Culture. When a Vaidika King rules all the subjects are taken as following the Vaidika Dharma = Arys Dharma. Since several Dravida Kings accepted the authority of The Vedas and the importance of Yajna as a means of thanks giving to the gods, there is no callinv the Dravidas Mlechchas!

response.answer_text: Mleechas were actually meluhas meaning upper or high land people! They were Dravidan because they traded with akkadian seasme seeds also called as 'Ellu' in Dravidan language word for sesame seeds This confirms they are Dravidans whom aryans encountered during their migration to india !

Mlecchas, as per Vedic reference they are the foreign barbaric uncultured invaders Of Bharat. Dravidian are the inheritance of Bharat & no mention anywhere in Vedic culture that Dravidians are mlecchas.

response.answer_text: The Asuras are the original inhabitants of this world, children born of Diti and Rishi Kashyap. They are divided later in to other denominations like Yakshas of Karnataka and Daityas of Kerala etc. They are the seekers of worldly wealth and pleasures - Draviyam- Dravida, they worshiped God as Sound and Linga, their Guru is Sukracharya. There was many Siddha Purushas among them, worshiped with reverence by the people. They are the visitors from Siddha loka, still help them. It is the Siddhas identified herbs that are used to fight agaist viral diseases.
